page.title: 12Ecology + Conservation Cont.
page.content: dual purpose of replacing woodland and forming a windbreak, but the keen winds have made it difficult for the saplings to establish initial growth. At Fulling Bridge Farm Mr. Bush has replaced woodland and created a 5 acre lake with islands by damming a small river valley. The lake is stock- ed with trout, but other fish, notably tench and roach have established themselves in great numbers. On the farm itself the waste drainage system has been designed so that the water is recycled over the land to avoid the pollution of the streams and lake. In front of the farm an old water meadow system has been preserved. At Lower Dunge Farm the medieval moat is an official preservation area. Consequently it is a flourishing wild life haven. The area inside the moat has not been officially excavated.
